title: PSG Wins UEFA Super Cup, Defeats Tottenham on Penalties
snippets: Paris St-Germain produce a stunning late comeback to beat Tottenham Hotspur on penalties and win the Uefa Super Cup in Udine.

• Paris Saint-Germain 2-2 Tottenham (4-3 pens)

  • PSG score two late goals to set up shootout

It turns out the DNA of serial ­winners cannot be developed within three months. Tottenham should have been able to announce themselves kings of the continent here in Ud
Tottenham's late collapse saw them blow a 2-0 UEFA Super Cup lead with five minutes to play as Paris Saint-Germain snatched the first European trophy of the season on penalties in Udine.
Paris Saint-Germain produced a dramatic late rally before beating Tottenham in a penalty shootout to win the UEFA Super Cup on Wednesday, securing a fifth trophy of 2025 for the French club.
titles: Spurs squander two-goal lead as PSG win Super Cup on penalties
Nuno Mendes gets PSG party started in Super Cup shootout win against Spurs
Tottenham heartbreak as PSG win Super Cup on penalties after late collapse
PSG beats Tottenham in penalty shootout to win UEFA Super Cup
summary: Paris Saint-Germain secured the UEFA Super Cup title after a remarkable comeback against Tottenham Hotspur, ending the match 2-2 in regular time and winning 4-3 on penalties. The game, held in Udine, saw PSG score two late goals to force a shootout, ultimately claiming their first European trophy of the season and their fifth trophy of 2025.

title: Leaders Meet Ahead of Trump-Putin Summit, Zelenskyy May Join Follow-Up
snippets: European leaders held a high-stakes meeting Wednesday with President Trump, Vice President Vance, Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelenskyy and NATO's chief ahead of Friday's U.S.-Russia summit.
The jockeying follows a virtual meeting between European leaders and the US and Ukrainian presidents on Wednesday.

Donald Trump suggested that if the meeting with Vladimir Putin in Alaska goes well, a second meeting will follow quickly. This time, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy would also be included. DW has more.
titles: Zelenskyy: Trump pursuing Ukraine ceasefire at Putin summit
Trump touts second trilateral meeting before Putin summit; Zelenskyy pushes
Ukraine updates: Trump floats meeting with Putin, Zelenskyy
summary: European leaders, along with President Trump, Vice President Vance, Ukraine's President Zelenskyy, and NATO's chief, convened for a significant meeting before the upcoming U.S.-Russia summit scheduled for Friday. This assembly aimed to strategize ahead of Trump's meeting with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Alaska, where Trump hinted at a potential follow-up meeting that would include President Zelenskyy, contingent on the success of the initial discussions. This series of meetings underscores the intricate diplomatic efforts underway concerning U.S.-Russia relations and Ukraine's involvem

title: Trump Warns Putin of Severe Consequences, Proposes Three-Way Summit on Ukraine
snippets: <a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMigAFBVV95cUxObzdIY2xiZ3IxeW9PWkZPYld5cER0djkzandnU3pRM2kzMm9xSFFhYnlfZHM4ZmFiX0tCUmpxRXVidkt1YTJFdVlWdkpaYWdHblhKTDNmM2VJVnA4a1BkRFk4aFNGSDBrYVdTR0s2QzA2dnNMeDdoRjFzd0pqX1hERA?oc=5" target="_blank">Trump: "Very severe" consequences for Putin if he ref

US president also says he would push for three-way summit with Volodymyr Zelenskyy if Alaska meeting goes well

Vladimir Putin will face “very severe consequences” if he does not agree a ceasefire in the war in Ukraine at his summit with Donald Trump in Alaska, the US president said on Wedne

US president praises ‘very good call’ with European leaders as he floats idea of meeting between Putin and Zelenskyy

Putin faces ‘very severe consequences’ if no Ukraine truce agreed, Trump says

summary: During a summit in Alaska, President Donald Trump warned Vladimir Putin of "very severe consequences" if a ceasefire in Ukraine is not agreed upon. Trump also expressed intentions to facilitate a three-way summit with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy if the Alaska talks are successful. Additionally, Trump reassured European leaders about the discussions with Putin, emphasizing a focus on achieving a ceasefire and the possibility of a meeting between Putin and Zelenskyy.

title: Perplexity Offers $34.5B for Google Chrome Amid Legal Scrutiny
snippets: US antitrust officials proposed last year that Google be forced to sell its Chrome web browser, after the company was found guilty of illegally monopolizing the search market. Now a potential buyer has stepped forward.
AI upstart Perplexity makes $34.5B offer for Google's Chrome &n
Perplexity's AI web browser, Comet, is mighty impressive, but the company also made an audacious $34.5 billion unsolicited bid to buy Chrome off Google.
titles: Google Chrome: AI startup Perplexity wants to buy browser
AI upstart Perplexity makes $34.5B offer for Google's Chrome - Axios
Is Perplexity the next Google?
summary: AI startup Perplexity has proposed a $34.5 billion acquisition of Google's Chrome browser. This bid follows an earlier attempt to purchase TikTok and comes amidst legal scrutiny over Google's dominance in the search market, with a judge considering mandating the sale of Chrome.

title: NBA Approves Record $6.1B Sale of Celtics to Chisholm-Led Group
snippets: The NBA board of governors unanimously approved the sale of the Celtics to a group led by private equity mogul Bill Chisholm, a deal that values the franchise at more than $6.1 billion -- the largest ever for an American professional sports team.

BOSTON (AP) — The NBA on Wednesday unanimously approved the sale of the Boston Celtics to a group led by private equity mogul Bill Chisholm, a deal that values the franchise at more than $6.1 billion — the largest ever for an American professional sports team. The league said the transac
titles: NBA approves C's sale at record $6.1B valuation
NBA approves sale of Boston Celtics to private equity mogul Bill Chisholm for record $6.1 billion
summary: The NBA board of governors unanimously approved the sale of the Boston Celtics to a group led by Bill Chisholm, a private equity mogul. This deal, valuing the franchise at over $6.1 billion, marks the largest ever for an American professional sports team.

title: Brazil's President Lula Launches 'Sovereign Brazil' Plan Amid US Tariffs
snippets: The plan, called 'Sovereign Brazil', will include credit for businesses that rely on exports.
Brazil's President Lula da Silva said the move is supposed to "create new things" out of the crisis resulted by Donald Trump's tariffs. But Lula also said his country is still ready to negotiate.
titles: Brazil plans aid packages for businesses impacted by Trump tariffs
Brazil announces $5.5B package to counter Trump's tariffs
summary: Brazil's President Lula da Silva announced the 'Sovereign Brazil' plan, aimed at supporting export-reliant businesses through credit. This initiative is a response to the economic challenges posed by Donald Trump's tariffs. Despite this move, Lula emphasized Brazil's openness to negotiation.

title: PSG Rallies from Two-Goal Deficit Against Tottenham in Season Opener
snippets: Tottenham let slip a two-goal lead as late PSG strikes sent European football's season opener to penalties in Italy.
PSG looked down and out, but Luis Enrique's team rallied when it mattered most

UEFA Super Cup score, highlights, takeaways: PSG beat Tottenham after dramatic comeback, penalty shootout
summary: In the European football season opener in Italy, Tottenham lost a two-goal lead to PSG, leading the match to penalties. PSG, despite looking defeated, made a comeback under Luis Enrique's leadership. The outcome of the match was not provided in the summary.

title: xAI Co-Founder Igor Babuschkin Leaves to Start Own Firm Amid Controversies
snippets: Igor Babuschkin, who helped start xAI in 2023, said in a post on X that he's leaving the artificial intelligence startup to launch his own venture firm.
Igor Babuschkin is leaving xAI less than three years after he co-founded the startup with Elon Musk, following a series of scandals at company.
titles: Elon Musk's xAI loses co-founder Igor Babuschkin, who's leaving to start venture firm
Co-founder of Elon Musk’s xAI departs the company
summary: Igor Babuschkin, a co-founder of xAI with Elon Musk in 2023, is departing the artificial intelligence startup to establish his own venture firm. His decision comes amid controversies surrounding xAI.

title: Protest Plans Escalate After 532 Arrests Over Palestine Action Ban
snippets: The battle over the Palestine Action ban now feels as much a political and PR clash as a legal one.

Defend Our Juries believes London protest in September could lead to ban being lifted, after 532 arrests on Saturday

The next mass protest against the ban on Palestine Action will aim to be twice the size of the last, organisers have said, as they increase pressure on the government to lift
titles: After mass arrests, what happens next with Palestine Action ban?
Next UK protest over Palestine Action ban aims to sign up 1,000 people
summary: The conflict surrounding the ban on Palestine Action has escalated into a significant political and public relations issue. Following 532 arrests during a London protest in September, the group Defend Our Juries is planning a larger protest with the goal of reversing the ban. This move indicates a strategic effort to intensify pressure on the government to reconsider its stance on Palestine Action.

title: Trump Rates Call with EU Leaders on Ukraine "a Ten," Vows to Prioritize Kyiv
snippets: Trump, who described the call as "a ten", was urged to keep Ukraine's interests at the forefront when he meets Putin on Friday.

European leaders said a call with President Donald Trump was unifying and that he agreed Ukraine should be part of any negotiations over territory, but some still worry he could give in to Russian President Vladimir Putin.
titles: European leaders tentatively hopeful after call with Trump ahead of Putin summit
Europeans, Zelensky cite unity with Trump ahead of Putin summit in Alaska
summary: President Trump described his call with European leaders about Ukraine as "a ten" and agreed that Ukraine's interests should be prioritized in his upcoming meeting with Russian President Vladimir Putin. Despite the unifying tone of the call, there are concerns among some European leaders that Trump might concede to Putin's demands in negotiations over territory.

title: NY Attorney General Sues Zelle Banks Over $1B Fraud Allegations
snippets: New York Attorney General Letitia James’ office picked up the lawsuit after the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau dropped a similar one in March.

New York Attorney General Letitia James is suing the banks behind Zelle over claims that their payment platform enabled “massive amounts of fraud” that caused customers to lose more than $1 billion between 2017 and 2023. In the lawsuit, James alleges Zelle was rushed to market, resulting in a design
titles: New York Sues Zelle—What To Know About Alleged $1 Billion Scams Over The App
New York claims Zelle’s shoddy security enabled a billion dollars in scams
summary: New York Attorney General Letitia James is suing the banks responsible for Zelle, alleging the payment platform facilitated over $1 billion in customer fraud from 2017 to 2023. The lawsuit claims Zelle was prematurely launched, leading to its flawed design that enabled fraud. This legal action follows the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau dropping a similar case in March.

title: Cleveland Browns Rookie QB Shedeur Sanders Injured in Practice
snippets: Sanders reportedly suffered an injury early during Wednesday's practice session

The quarterbacks in Cleveland can’t escape the injury bug.

Cleveland Browns rookie QB Shedeur Sanders injured his oblique while throwing at practice, ESPN’s Adam Schefter reported on Wednesday.

Browns QB Shedeur Sanders injured at practice
summary: Cleveland Browns rookie QB Shedeur Sanders suffered an oblique injury during practice on Wednesday. The injury adds to the list of quarterback injuries in Cleveland. The current status of Sanders' injury and recovery timeline is not provided in the sources.

title: Tottenham Loses Super Cup to PSG, Coach Frank Remains Optimistic
snippets: Tottenham were left feeling low after the Super Cup slipped from their grasp against Paris St-Germain - but there are still reasons for new head coach Thomas Frank to be upbeat.
Tottenham were left feeling low after the Super Cup slipped from their grasp against Paris St-Germain - but there are still reasons for new head coach Thomas Frank to be upbeat.

Work to do as Spurs collapse - but promising signs for Frank

The team's defeat in the Super Cup has left them feeling low, but there are positive signs for their future under Frank's leadership.

title: Taylor Swift Announces New Album, Set for "New Heights" Appearance

title: New Delivery Service Launches in 1,000+ Cities, Eyes 2,300 by Year-End
snippets: The service is launching in more than 1,000 U.S. cities and towns, with plans to expand to at least 2,300 locations by the end of this year.

Shoppers can now order fresh grocery items, including produce, dairy, meat, seafood, baked goods, and more, alongside everyday household products, electronics, and other items available for same-day delivery.
titles: Amazon launches same-day delivery of meat, eggs, produce in more than 1,000 cities
Amazon rolls out same-day delivery of perishable groceries in 1,000 US cities
summary: A new delivery service has launched in over 1,000 U.S. cities and towns, offering same-day delivery of fresh groceries such as produce, dairy, meat, seafood, and baked goods, in addition to household products and electronics. The service aims to expand to at least 2,300 locations by the end of the year.

With recent earnings reports from Martinrea International Inc. and Linamar Corp., both firms highlighte

Trump at the White House Wednesday for the historic signing of the Executive Order (EO), “Enabling Competition in the Commercial Space Industry.” “People think the Department of Transportation (DOT) is

title: Quantum Echo Discovered in Superconductors, Boosting Quantum Computing Hopes
titles: Scientists Discover Mysterious “Quantum Echo” in Superconductors
summary: Scientists have discovered a phenomenon known as "quantum echo" in superconductors, which could have significant implications for quantum computing. This finding reveals new insights into the behavior of quantum systems and their potential for enhancing computational power and efficiency. The research highlights the complex interactions within superconductors and opens up new avenues for exploring quantum mechanics.

title: New Phase of Matter Discovered with Unusual Electron Behavior
titles: This Strange Electron Behavior Just Revealed a New Phase of Matter
summary: Researchers have identified a new phase of matter, marked by unusual electron behavior. This discovery, highlighted by the observation of electrons moving in unexpected ways, expands our understanding of the physical properties of matter. The current status of this finding is that it opens new avenues for research in material science and physics, potentially leading to advancements in technology and our comprehension of the universe's fundamental aspects.

title: China's First Shipborne Ozone Study in South China Sea
snippets: As human activity across the world's oceans expands, scientists are zeroing in on shifts in atmospheric composition—particularly ozone, a key player in marine atmospheric chemistry. In a new study, researchers have completed China's first shipborne ozone-sounding campaign in the South China Sea, yie
titles: Researchers complete first oceanic ozone campaign in the South China Sea, revealing typhoon impacts
summary: Scientists have conducted China's first shipborne ozone-sounding campaign in the South China Sea, focusing on the impact of human activity on the ocean's atmospheric chemistry, specifically ozone levels. This research aims to understand the shifts in atmospheric composition due to increased human activity in marine environments.

title: Traditional Reading Methods Outperform Digital Tools for Preschoolers
snippets: When it comes to teaching preschoolers their ABCs, sticking with the basics might just be more effective. Despite the rise of digital tools and educational games, learning to read still begins with simple, hands-on work, such as writing letters and spotting words in everyday life.
titles: Print beats digital for preschoolers learning to read, study finds
summary: Recent findings suggest that traditional methods of teaching reading skills to preschoolers, such as handwriting practice and recognizing words in daily surroundings, remain more effective than digital tools and educational games. This emphasizes the importance of hands-on activities in early literacy development.

title: Poor Air Quality May Cause Major School Absences, Study Finds
snippets: As the school year begins in many areas, new West Virginia University research finds poor air quality may keep tens of thousands of students out of school for weeks each year, hitting young students and children of color the hardest.
titles: School absences study links dirty air to empty desks
summary: New research from West Virginia University indicates that poor air quality could result in tens of thousands of students missing school for weeks annually, with the greatest impact on young students and children of color. This study highlights the significant effect of environmental factors on educational attendance as the new school year starts in many regions.

title: Physicists Unveil "Quantum Lie Detector" for Authenticating Quantum Computations
titles: Is Your Quantum Computer Faking It? Physicists Unveil a “Quantum Lie Detector”
summary: Physicists have developed a "quantum lie detector" to determine if quantum computers are truly performing complex quantum computations or merely simulating them with classical computing methods. This tool aims to ensure the authenticity of quantum computing processes, addressing concerns about the genuine capabilities of quantum machines.

title: Infrared Thermography: A Stress-Free Temperature Check for Animals
snippets: Traditional veterinary practices utilize rectal measurements to assess body temperature, but this method is stressful and does not capture continuous changes in body temperature. Fortunately, recent advancements have introduced infrared thermography, which can noninvasively measure body temperatures
titles: AI-enhanced infrared thermography offers improved detection of temperature patterns in calves
summary: Recent advancements in veterinary care have introduced infrared thermography as a noninvasive method for measuring body temperatures in animals. This technology offers an alternative to the traditional, more stressful rectal measurements, allowing for continuous monitoring of temperature changes.
